name: impersonation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] the act of intentionally copying another person's characteristics, such as his or her behaviour, speech, appearance, or expressions, especially to make people laugh: do an impersonation He does a brilliant impersonation of Charles. Sally enlivens her anecdotes with hilarious impersonations.
[ U ] the act of attempting to deceive someone by pretending that you are another person: He was charged with impersonation of a police officer. Voter impersonation is the least common kind of voter fraud. See
impersonate
More examplesFewer examplesMy dad was doing a passable impersonation of Fred Astaire.Djokovic is famed on the tennis circuit for his impersonations of fellow players.It is a sad fact that identity fraud or impersonation is increasingly common. Students need to be educated about the dangers on the Internet, including identity theft, false impersonation and bullying.
